channel.title: UID help

item.title: UID help
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Sessy Pk3r:

Code your server properly and you won’t have to worry about cheat clients. Try enabling RSA to start.

I hope you are aware that RSA only secures your traffic to an unknown third party. If they have access to your source code or methods, they can use it just the same. The purpose of RSA is to prevent network sniffers from picking up your server/client information from the traffic. The server/client already has packet ID encryption which prevents a plain network flood. It must use the client’s stream which can be done with Reflection. Gaining access to the stream will give access to send any traffic they want, because the encrypter is internal.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dleUxfghd5I[/youtube]
As you can see both the client and the server have the same means to communicate with each other. The secret likes in the complexity of your IO system. The higher up in the chain your message is encrypted the less likely anything will beable to mimic it.
its easier to call

because createFrame is the single element that controls the encrypted value.
but if you were to call

it thus separates the encryption method and requires who ever is trying to use the client maliciously to keep track of what they have to do. to get the correct value for the encrypted id. since they can no longer find all of this information in just 1 place.

Read full topic

@Barragescapepvp wrote:

Sessy Pk3r:

Code your server properly and you won’t have to worry about cheat clients. Try enabling RSA to start.

Ever heard of Starters? As in people who just got into RSPS Development? I’m sure you were one of those before… So was I. Maybe make a suggestion on how he could possibly fix this instead of being smart about it? And he probably doesn’t know what RSA is…

item.title: UID help
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

That UID must be incorrect, I recall client UID being an integer (4 bytes long not 1). Read it properly and you should be all good.

item.title: UID help
item.dc:creator: @Muhamed1 Muhamed1
item.description:
@Muhamed1 wrote:

int uid = buffer.readByte();
if(uid != 040) {
System.out.println(“UID”);
channel.close();
return null;
}

is that correct? because it’s not letting me to log in with correct UID.

i only need uid to avoid stresstesting i’ve a system for cheat clients…
